column10: ASK IF ="Yes"

column2: Have you done this to try to change your shape or weight?
column10: ASK IF ="Yes"

column2: Which rating best describes the number of days on which the subject has consciously attempted to restrict his/her food instake, whether or not he/she has succeeded?
column16: 2 = Attempted to exercise restraint on less than half the days
column18: 4 = Attempted to exercise restraint on more than half the days
column20: 6 = Attempted to exercise restraint every day

column2: Over the past four weeks, have you ever not eaten anything for most of the day?
If so, about what time would you decide to not eat?
About what time would you start eating again?
How often has this happened?
Why have you done this?
Have you done this to try and change your shape and weight?

Which rating best describes the number of days on which there has been at least eight hours abstinence from eating food (soup and milk-shakes count as food, whereas drinks in general do not) during waking hours?
column16: 2 = Avoidance on less than half the days
column18: 4 = Avoidance on more than half the days
column20: 6 = Avoidance every day

Is it because you like to feel hungry?
How often have you wanted this?

column16: 2 = Definite desire to have an empty stomach on less than half the days
column18: 4 = Definite desire to have an empty stomach on more than half the days

column18: 4 = Attempted to avoid food on more than half the days
column20: 6 = Attempted to avoid food every day

column2: Over the past four weeks have you tried to stick to certain definite rules about your eating; for example, only allowing yourself a certain number of calories, or a certain amount of food, or rules about what you should eat or when you should eat?
Have there been times when you know you have broken one of your own rules about eating?
Would you keep to them if you were not made to break them by your parents?
How have you felt about breaking them?
How would you have felt if you had broken one of your eating rules?
What are your rules?
Why have you tried to stick to them?
Did you make them to try to change your shape or weight?
Do you try to stick to them every day?
If not, how often do you try to stick to them?

Are they about certain foods or are they more general? Please describe (You will need to give some examples at this point. Examples of definite rules would be “I must not eat eggs” or “I must not eat cake”, whereas a general principle would be “I should try to eat healthy food”.
Which rating best describes the number of days on which the subject has actively attempted to adhere to his/her dietary rule(s) from the past four weeks?
column14: 0 = Has not attempted to obey such rules
column16: 2 = Attempted to obey such rules on less than half the days
column18: 4 = Attempted to obey such rules on more than half the days
column20: 6 = Attempted to obey such rules every day

column16: 2 = Concentration impairment on less than half the days
column18: 4 = Concentration impairment on more than half the days
column20: 6 = Concentration impairment every day

column2: Over the past four weeks have you been frightened of losing control over eating?

How often have you felt like this?

column16: 2 = Fear of losing control present on less than half the days
column18: 4 = Fear of losing control present on more than half the days
column20: 6 = Fear of losing control present every day

column14: 0 = No extreme restriction outside objective bulimic episodes

column17: 9 = Not applicable, since no objective bulimic episodes during the month in question.

column2: Over the past four weeks have you been worried about other people seeing you eat?

column14: 0 = No concern about being seen eating by others and no avoidance of such occasions.

column18: 4 = Has felt definite concern, and have avoided some such occasions.
column20: 6 = Has felt definite concern, and has avoided all such occasions.
column22: 8 = Has felt definite concern, but was unable to avoid such occasions.

Over the past four weeks, how have you felt about your weight?
Have you felt dissatisfied with your weight?
Has this made you really miserable or unhappy?
Which rating best describes the child’s attitude to his/her weight? This should represent the average for the entire month.
column16: 2 = Slight dissatisfaction (no associated distress)
column18: 4 = Moderate dissatisfaction (some associated distress)
column20: 6 = Marked dissatisfaction (extreme concern and distress; weight totally unacceptable)

column2: Over the last four weeks, have you wanted to lose weight?
Have you had a very strong wish to lose weight?
Which rating best describes the number of days on which there has been a strong desire to lose weight?
column14: 0 = No strong desire to lose weight
column16: 2 = Strong desire present on less than half the days
column18: 4 = Strong desire present on more than half the days
column20: 6 = Strong desire present every day

column2: What weight would you like to be?
column14: 888 = if subject is not interested in his/her weight
column15: 777 = if no specific weight would be low enough
column16: 666 = if the subject is primarily intersted in his/her shape, but has some concern about weight (but not a specific weight)

column2: What weight would you like to be?
How would you feel if you were told to weight yourself once a week for the next four weeks?
Which rating best describes the strength of the negative reaction from the child to this question?
column16: 2 = Slight reaction
column18: 4 = Moderate reaction (definite reaction, but manageable)
column20: 6 = Marked reaction (pronounced reaction which would affect other aspects of the child’s life).

column2: How would you feel if you were told that you could only weigh yourself once a week and not more often?

column16: 2 = Slight reaction
column18: 4 = Moderate reaction (definite reaction, but manageable)
column20: 6 = Marked reaction (pronounced reaction which would affect other aspects of the child’s life).

column2: Over the past four weeks, how have you felt about your shape?

column18: 4 = Concentration impairment on more than half the days
column20: 6 = Concentration impairment every day
